<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/tesla-stock-surges-20?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nikola Would Be Proud
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo of a Tesla vehicle parking lot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNzcwODU2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tesla</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla shares shot up 19.9% yesterday after an analyst said the company's stock was a Musk-have. Argus's Bill Selesky <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/tesla-stock-rockets-past-700-after-analyst-sets-new-street-high-target-2020-02-03?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised his price target</a> to $808, citing revenue growth from the Model S and Model X and fierce demand for the Model 3.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Tesla's on a run topped only by Jeremy Lin in February 2012. Its share price has skyrocketed over 80% since the beginning of the year and over 200% since October.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">...why?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Financial markets are mysterious, but it's hard to ignore a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-03/tesla-share-surge-continues-with-more-good-news-pouring-in?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wave of good vibes</a> for the electric automaker:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Yesterday, Panasonic said Tesla's production surge helped its battery business become profitable last quarter.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Baillie Gifford & Co, Tesla's second-largest shareholder after CEO Elon Musk, upped its stake.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over the weekend, ARK Investment Management's CEO said Tesla's stock is "incredibly undervalued." How undervalued? She thinks the company will hit $7,000 in 2024. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">An interesting subplot: </strong>Tesla is a popular stock to "short," or bet against. That's obviously been a losing bet, so some analysts have speculated that Tesla short traders are scrambling to cover (aka liquidate) their positions—a strategy that typically drives the stock price higher.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Despite rumors, experts </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/short-squeeze-isn-t-fuel-185840127.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don't have clear data</a></span><span> to show that a "short squeeze," as it’s known, is driving the rally. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Micro to macro </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether you think Tesla's stock price will hit $7,000 or go to zero, the company is the clear leader in an increasingly competitive field for electric vehicles.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Note Sunday's Super Bowl ads, which treated us to an extra-creamy buffalo chicken dip of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/03/emerging-tech-featured-super-bowl-liv-ads?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new electric vehicle models</a> from legacy carmakers. The star power alone should tell you how seriously these companies view the threat posed by Tesla.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Audi recruited Arya Stark to promote its e-tron Sportback.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>LeBron James lent his voice to GMC's revived electric Hummer truck. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ford enlisted Idris Elba (a former night shift worker at one of its plant) to drum up buzz for the electric Mustang SUV. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>It's possible to go to "<a href="https://www.wired.com/story/elon-musk-tesla-life-inside-gigafactory/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">production hell</a>" and back. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/gilead-testing-coronavirus-treatment-china?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pharma Does Its Best Work Under Pressure
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt=" A woman shows a test for the new 2019-nCov virus during a press tour in a laboratory of the State Health Office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNzcwOTUzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sebastian Gollnow/picture alliance via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, shares in biotech Gilead Sciences rose 5% thanks to news it's <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-03/gilead-drug-to-undergo-human-trials-in-china-to-cure-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">running clinical trials</a> with a Chinese medical team for a coronavirus treatment. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gilead developed the drug, remdesivir, during the 2014 Ebola outbreak, though it was later sidelined and hasn’t yet received regulatory approval. But if tests go well, China could provide conditional approval.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The ugly truth </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Global disease outbreaks are a huge business opportunity for Big Pharma. Drugmakers including GSK, Johnson & Johnson, Inovio, Moderna, and Novavax are all <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/03/investing/gilead-sciences-coronavirus-stock/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working</a> on coronavirus treatments. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whoever gets it right first will score a substantial short-term bump as governments pounce faster than a college freshman for Four Loko. Countries will also stockpile vaccines in case of future outbreaks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Even if they're put on the fast-track by pharma, governments, and global health organizations, treatments could spend months in development. Getting them to the public could take well over a year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>The death toll from the virus reached 425. Here's a <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/China_Flu/comments/exe552/coronavirus_faq_misconceptions_information_from_a/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=ios_app&utm_name=iossmf&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">useful thread</a> with lots of stats. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/google-breaks-youtube-cloud-revenue-first-time?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Is YouTube's Annual Revenue?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of YouTube's logo " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1567631569.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of YouTube's logo " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1567631569.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Drawing a blank? You are in good company. Very few people outside of Mountain View, CA, knew the number before yesterday, when Google parent Alphabet made the surprising decision to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/03/alphabet-googl-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disclose</a> the video platform's revenue for the first time.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Here's your answer: </strong></span><span>YouTube generated $15.1 billion in ad revenue in 2019 and $4.7 billion last quarter. Be honest—is that more or less than you expected?</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There were more surprises: </strong>The company also gave numbers for its young but growing cloud business, which did $8.9 billion in revenue in 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google's <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-parent-posts-disappointing-earnings-but-discloses-new-youtube-cloud-details-11580765421?mod=breakingnews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">total revenue</a> last quarter was $46.1 billion, short of expectations. It's also missed on operating income ($9.3 billion in Q4) for nine of the last 10 quarters. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Because Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page stepped down in December, yesterday was Sundar Pichai's first earnings call as the CEO of both Google and Alphabet. It appears he has a few growth stains not even flashy YouTube numbers can cover up. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CONSUMER GOODS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/antitrust-hammer-comes-edgewells-acquisition-harrys?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
FTC Gives Edgewell the Harry Eyeball
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A razor without any razors " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNzc1NDMzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/2/3/21120169/harrys-ftc-acquisition-edgewell-schick-gillette-dollar-shave-club?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it’s suing</a> to block Edgewell Personal Care’s $1.4 billion acquisition of direct-to-consumer (D2C) razor brand Harry’s. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Never heard of Edgewell? The consumer goods company spun out of Energizer Holdings in 2015 and owns Schick and Wilkinson Sword razors. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When your flagship product is nearly a century old and more readily associated with preteen razor burn than a smooth e-commerce shave, razor revenue and profit will fall five years running. Even Edgewell’s CEO <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-17/schick-owner-taps-harry-s-founders-to-lead-north-american-unit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acknowledges</a> Schick has “gotten a little boring.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So last May, Edgewell announced it was buying its disruptor to help take on the competition:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Procter & Gamble owns almost every household razor brand, from upstarts like Bevel to heavyweights like Gillette, which dominates almost half the global men’s shaving market, per Euromonitor. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Unilever bought Dollar Shave Club for $1 billion in 2016.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And now the FTC thinks a Harry’s acquisition will </span><span><a href="https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2020/02/ftc-files-suit-block-edgewell-personal-care-companys-acquisition?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">send prices back up</a></span><span> and competition back down.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Emerging D2C brands are disrupting the old guard. But when the disrupted buy up the disruptors, it sometimes creates antitrust concerns.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F03%2Fantitrust-hammer-comes-edgewells-acquisition-harrys" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>

<!-- <![endif]-->

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now you can trade individual shares in masterpiece paintings by the all-time greats with the Masterworks art trading platform. We’re talking about the blue-chips that regularly sell for tens of millions and appreciate at 8%–30% annually.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How’s it work? Glad you asked: Masterworks buys a painting and sells shares to investors. When the painting sells, you receive your portion of the proceeds. Or sell your shares on the trading platform for a gain. It’s that simple. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> You can diversify your portfolio by investing in an asset class that’s not correlated with the stock market. <table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maybe you're the kind of person who holds your plank an extra 15 seconds during 4am HIIT class (showoff). Maybe you need a full day to recover from 20 minutes on the elliptical.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Either way, this one likely applies to you: </strong>obsessed with tech. The current fixation with new-wave, at-home, tech-enabled fitness is changing the way we define success, both in terms of personal health goals and happy business endings (IPOs).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew's </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> podcast, </strong>we talk to the CEO of one of the most exciting startups in the industry, Mirror’s Brynn Putnam. Brynn explains…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What works about the at-home fitness business model</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How good tech and smart engineering can scale the unscalable</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why every company is fighting for a tech valuation, even if it doesn't deserve one</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One parting idea: Putnam thinks in-home fitness streaming devices can become the next iPhone. Do you?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen to the episode and decide for yourself:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Putnam_apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Putnam_spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Putnam_all?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla shares shot up 19.9% yesterday after an analyst said the company's stock was a Musk-have. Argus's Bill Selesky \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/tesla-stock-rockets-past-700-after-analyst-sets-new-street-high-target-2020-02-03?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised his price target\u003c/a\u003e to $808, citing revenue growth from the Model S and Model X and fierce demand for the Model 3.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla's on a run topped only by Jeremy Lin in February 2012. Its share price has skyrocketed over 80% since the beginning of the year and over 200% since October.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e...why?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFinancial markets are mysterious, but it's hard to ignore a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-03/tesla-share-surge-continues-with-more-good-news-pouring-in?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewave of good vibes\u003c/a\u003e for the electric automaker:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, Panasonic said Tesla's production surge helped its battery business become profitable last quarter.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBaillie Gifford \u0026 Co, Tesla's second-largest shareholder after CEO Elon Musk, upped its stake.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver the weekend, ARK Investment Management's CEO said Tesla's stock is \"incredibly undervalued.\" How undervalued? She thinks the company will hit $7,000 in 2024. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAn interesting subplot: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla is a popular stock to \"short,\" or bet against. That's obviously been a losing bet, so some analysts have speculated that Tesla short traders are scrambling to cover (aka liquidate) their positions—a strategy that typically drives the stock price higher.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDespite rumors, experts \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/short-squeeze-isn-t-fuel-185840127.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon't have clear data\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to show that a \"short squeeze,\" as it’s known, is driving the rally. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMicro to macro \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhether you think Tesla's stock price will hit $7,000 or go to zero, the company is the clear leader in an increasingly competitive field for electric vehicles.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNote Sunday's Super Bowl ads, which treated us to an extra-creamy buffalo chicken dip of \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/03/emerging-tech-featured-super-bowl-liv-ads?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew electric vehicle models\u003c/a\u003e from legacy carmakers. The star power alone should tell you how seriously these companies view the threat posed by Tesla.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAudi recruited Arya Stark to promote its e-tron Sportback.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLeBron James lent his voice to GMC's revived electric Hummer truck. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFord enlisted Idris Elba (a former night shift worker at one of its plant) to drum up buzz for the electric Mustang SUV. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIt's possible to go to \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/elon-musk-tesla-life-inside-gigafactory/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, shares in biotech Gilead Sciences rose 5% thanks to news it's \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-03/gilead-drug-to-undergo-human-trials-in-china-to-cure-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erunning clinical trials\u003c/a\u003e with a Chinese medical team for a coronavirus treatment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGilead developed the drug, remdesivir, during the 2014 Ebola outbreak, though it was later sidelined and hasn’t yet received regulatory approval. But if tests go well, China could provide conditional approval.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe ugly truth \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGlobal disease outbreaks are a huge business opportunity for Big Pharma. Drugmakers including GSK, Johnson \u0026 Johnson, Inovio, Moderna, and Novavax are all \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/03/investing/gilead-sciences-coronavirus-stock/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworking\u003c/a\u003e on coronavirus treatments. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhoever gets it right first will score a substantial short-term bump as governments pounce faster than a college freshman for Four Loko. Countries will also stockpile vaccines in case of future outbreaks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eEven if they're put on the fast-track by pharma, governments, and global health organizations, treatments could spend months in development. Getting them to the public could take well over a year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eThe death toll from the virus reached 425. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDrawing a blank? You are in good company. Very few people outside of Mountain View, CA, knew the number before yesterday, when Google parent Alphabet made the surprising decision to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/03/alphabet-googl-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisclose\u003c/a\u003e the video platform's revenue for the first time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere's your answer: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYouTube generated $15.1 billion in ad revenue in 2019 and $4.7 billion last quarter. Be honest—is that more or less than you expected?\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere were more surprises: \u003c/strong\u003eThe company also gave numbers for its young but growing cloud business, which did $8.9 billion in revenue in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle's \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-parent-posts-disappointing-earnings-but-discloses-new-youtube-cloud-details-11580765421?mod=breakingnews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etotal revenue\u003c/a\u003e last quarter was $46.1 billion, short of expectations. It's also missed on operating income ($9.3 billion in Q4) for nine of the last 10 quarters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page stepped down in December, yesterday was Sundar Pichai's first earnings call as the CEO of both Google and Alphabet. It appears he has a few growth stains not even flashy YouTube numbers can cover up. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/2/3/21120169/harrys-ftc-acquisition-edgewell-schick-gillette-dollar-shave-club?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid it’s suing\u003c/a\u003e to block Edgewell Personal Care’s $1.4 billion acquisition of direct-to-consumer (D2C) razor brand Harry’s. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNever heard of Edgewell? The consumer goods company spun out of Energizer Holdings in 2015 and owns Schick and Wilkinson Sword razors. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen your flagship product is nearly a century old and more readily associated with preteen razor burn than a smooth e-commerce shave, razor revenue and profit will fall five years running. Even Edgewell’s CEO \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-17/schick-owner-taps-harry-s-founders-to-lead-north-american-unit?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacknowledges\u003c/a\u003e Schick has “gotten a little boring.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo last May, Edgewell announced it was buying its disruptor to help take on the competition:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eProcter \u0026 Gamble owns almost every household razor brand, from upstarts like Bevel to heavyweights like Gillette, which dominates almost half the global men’s shaving market, per Euromonitor. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnilever bought Dollar Shave Club for $1 billion in 2016.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd now the FTC thinks a Harry’s acquisition will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2020/02/ftc-files-suit-block-edgewell-personal-care-companys-acquisition?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esend prices back up\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and competition back down.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eEmerging D2C brands are disrupting the old guard. But when the disrupted buy up the disruptors, it sometimes creates antitrust concerns.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
